issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When I tried log in to console installed on CentOS with ssl enabled  I got internal error. Movie attached. 

I see internal error on both FF and Chrome.

console.ini
{code}
######################################
# Eucalyptus Management Console Config
######################################


###################
# App configuration
# http://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/pyramid/en/latest/narr/environment.html
###
[app:main]
use = egg:eucaconsole

## EUCA config
clchost = localhost
clcport = 8773
# since eucalyptus allows for different services to be located on different
# physical hosts, you may override the above host and port for each service.
# The service list is [ec2, autoscale, cloudwatch, elb, iam, sts].
# For each, you can specify a different host and/or port, for example;
#elb.host=10.20.30.40
#elb.port=443


help.url=https://engage.eucalyptus.com?r=euca-
# admin support url
support.url=
# examples:
#support.url=http://your-cloud-admin-portal/
#support.url=mailto: support@yourdomain.com

## AWS settings ##
aws.enabled = True
# set this to define a default region for aws login
aws.default.region = us-east-1

# configures value use for cache control on static assets (in seconds)
static.cache.duration=43200

# if true, login forms will support browser password save, if false, browser won't prompt to save
browser.password.save = true

# enables SSL certificate validation on communication to the cloud service endpoints.
# all communication to those services uses SSL already, but enabling this requires a properly signed cert.
connection.ssl.validation = false
# use this value to override the default cacerts.txt that comes with boto
#connection.ssl.certfile = cacerts.txt

# sets connection debug on, which really sets boto's log level to DEBUG
# This provides a lot of information about console <-> CLC communication.
connection.debug = false

## Pyramid settings ##
pyramid.reload_templates = false
pyramid.debug_authorization = false
pyramid.debug_notfound = false
pyramid.debug_routematch = false
pyramid.default_locale_name = en
pyramid.includes =
    pyramid_beaker
    pyramid_chameleon
    pyramid_layout
#    pyramid_debugtoolbar

## Session config ##
# See http://beaker.readthedocs.org/en/latest/configuration.html
#
# Session type is one of cookie, file, dbm, memory, ext:memcached, ext:database, ext:google
# The 'cookie' session type has a hard limit of 4096 bytes
session.type = cookie
session.key = eucaconsole_session
session.keyini = /etc/eucaconsole/session-keys.ini
session.httponly = true
# Secure session implies SSL setup
session.secure = true 
# Idle timeout (1800 sec = 30 min)
session.timeout = 1800
# Absolute timeout (43200 sec = 12 hours)
session.cookie_expires = 43200

## Cache config ##
# See https://pyramid_beaker.readthedocs.org/en/latest/#beaker-cache-region-support
cache.regions = default_term, second, short_term, long_term, extra_long_term
cache.type = memory
# expiration units are seconds
cache.second.expire = 1
cache.short_term.expire = 60
cache.default_term.expire = 300
cache.long_term.expire = 3600
cache.extra_long_term.expire = 43200


###########################
# WSGI server configuration
###
[server:main]
use = egg:gunicorn#main
host = 0.0.0.0
port = 8888
workers = 4
worker_class = gevent


#######################
# Logging configuration
# http://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/pyramid/en/latest/narr/logging.html
###
[loggers]
keys = root

[handlers]
keys = screen_debug, logfile

[formatters]
keys = generic, eucaformat

[logger_root]
handlers = logfile
level = INFO
# handlers = logfile, screen_debug

[handler_screen_debug]
class = StreamHandler
args = (sys.stdout,)
level = NOTSET
formatter = generic

[handler_logfile]
class = handlers.RotatingFileHandler
args = ('/var/log/eucaconsole.log', 'a', 'maxBytes=1000000', 'backupCount=10')
# args = ('/tmp/eucalyptus_console.log', 'a', 'maxBytes=1000000', 'backupCount=10')
level = NOTSET
formatter = eucaformat

[formatter_generic]
format = %(asctime)s %(levelname)-5.5s [%(name)s][%(threadName)s] %(message)s

[formatter_eucaformat]
format = %(asctime)-15s %(levelname)s %(message)s
datefmt = %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S
{code}

Console installed from following packages:

{code}
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.0.1                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.3305.14.20140909gitfc21a91.el6   Build Date: Tue 09 Sep 2014 07:50:32 PM PDT
Install Date: Fri 12 Sep 2014 09:24:38 AM PDT      Build Host: ip-172-26-118-50
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.0.1-0.0.3305.14.20140909gitfc21a91.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 7303910                          License: BSD and MIT and OFL
Signature   : (none)
URL         : http://github.com/eucalyptus/koala
Summary     : Eucalyptus Management Console
Description :
This package contains the web UI for the Eucalyptus cloud platform.
It also works with Amazon Web Services.
{code}
fields.summary: Internal error when console is set up with ssl enabled

comments.body:
I have seen this error in eucaconsole.log

{code}
2014-09-16 13:36:51 ERROR Error handling request
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/async.py", line 45, in handle
    self.handle_request(listener, req, client, addr)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/ggevent.py", line 151, in handle_request
    super(GeventWorker, self).handle_request(*args)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/async.py", line 93, in handle_request
    respiter = self.wsgi(environ, resp.start_response)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/router.py", line 251, in __call__
    response = self.invoke_subrequest(request, use_tweens=True)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/router.py", line 227, in invoke_subrequest
    response = handle_request(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/tweens.py", line 78, in __call__
    response = self.handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/tweens.py", line 53, in tween
    response = handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/tweens.py", line 42, in tween
    response = handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/tweens.py", line 21, in excview_tween
    response = handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/router.py", line 161, in handle_request
    response = view_callable(context, request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 586, in __call__
    return view(context, request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 319, in attr_view
    return view(context, request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 295, in predicate_wrapper
    return view(context, request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 345, in rendered_view
    result = view(context, request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 467, in _class_requestonly_view
    response = getattr(inst, attr)()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/views/login.py", line 109, in handle_login
    return self.handle_euca_login()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/views/login.py", line 122, in handle_euca_login
    conn = AWSAuthConnection(None)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/connection.py", line 558, in __init__
    profile_name)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/provider.py", line 185, in __init__
    self.get_credentials(access_key, secret_key, security_token, profile_name)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/provider.py", line 309, in get_credentials
    self._populate_keys_from_metadata_server()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/provider.py", line 328, in _populate_keys_from_metadata_server
    self._access_key = security['AccessKeyId']
TypeError: list indices must be integers, not str
{code}

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/compare/v4.0.1...maint-4.0

Looking at these changes. The stack trace shows an error in code that communicates with the CLC, not the browser, so it's odd that enabling SSL for the browser would cause a problem here.
I will re-test the issue on a fresh setup.

Investigation shows:
boto is 2.27.0, which is same as I develop with
It's running on a CLC.
The boto error is where it tries fetching creds from instance metadata.
This code has worked fine on other centos and osx machines
It is checking instance metadata since I didn't supply access or secret keys.  That was intentional since I needed to use the AWSQueryConnection simply to get access to the boto ca cert file (when validating SSL cert of CLC)
[~dkavanagh], I reproduced the issue on https://10.111.5.9 multicluster setup.

I have seen this error in cloud-output.log
{code}
2014-09-18 14:27:56  WARN | Failed to find account by canonical ID 4e4f24215b2a352b3b25231162b162b4e27551d11a4b01743d3a3d23574a1443
2014-09-18 14:28:04  INFO | pushing out the X509 certificate for user admin
2014-09-18 14:28:05  INFO | :1411075685346:DefaultCryptoProvider:GENERATE_CERTIFICATE:CN=admin, OU=Eucalyptus, O=User, C=US:CN=admin, OU=Eucalyptus, O=User, C=US
2014-09-18 14:28:13  INFO | pushing out the X509 certificate for user admin
2014-09-18 14:28:14  INFO | :1411075694344:DefaultCryptoProvider:GENERATE_CERTIFICATE:CN=admin, OU=Eucalyptus, O=User, C=US:CN=admin, OU=Eucalyptus, O=User, C=US
2014-09-18 14:28:22  INFO | pushing out the X509 certificate for user admin
2014-09-18 14:28:22  INFO | :1411075702843:DefaultCryptoProvider:GENERATE_CERTIFICATE:CN=admin, OU=Eucalyptus, O=User, C=US:CN=admin, OU=Eucalyptus, O=User, C=US
2014-09-18 15:40:54 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:40:54 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:41:04 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:41:04 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:41:06 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:41:06 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:41:09 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:41:09 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:41:22 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:41:22 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:44:02 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:44:02 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:46:55 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:46:55 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:47:10 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
2014-09-18 15:47:10 ERROR | Binding factory is empty
{code}

I've tested a fix. I suspected this would work before, but didn't know the root cause (and still don't). The fix tricks boto into thinking the keys are set, so then it won't try pulling them from metadata (which is where this is failing). Will push a PR soon.
